questions.question_text: Within Software Asset Management there are many key terms to understand, what is the best definition for Software Allocation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Software allocations in ServiceNow’s Software Asset Management Professional product are records that grant one or many right(s), are identified on the entitlement record, and assigned to a user or device to use the software.
I agree - It's answer A - the definition is on page 8 of the ServiceNow SAM pro text that came with the course.

Selected Answer: A
Software allocation: records that grant one or many rights, are identified on the entitlement record and assigned to a user or device to use the software. Entitlements that have available rights may be allocated to multiple users or devices, so each entitlement will have multiple allocations.

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-service-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/task/t_AddAnEntitlementAllocationSAMF.html

A user or device allocation can be added to a software entitlement to specify a user or device to which rights have been allocated.

Selected Answer: A
Question is about Software Allocation.
I agree it should be "A"

Selected Answer: A
A is the definition of allocation

Answer is the definition of allocation 

A
It's answer A -

Selected Answer: A
Who made this put random answers...

Selected Answer: A
A is what serviceNow has mentioned

Selected Answer: A
right definition

choices.A: One or more use rights assigned to a specific device or user.
choices.D: Finding and recognizing software or a software feature on a device.
choices.C: The process of normalizing a discovered software installation to standardized values.

choices.D: Nightly for new discovery models and weekly for all discovery models that do not have a status of normalized or manually normalized
choices.E: Immediately for new discovery models and nightly for all discovery models that do not have a status of normalized or manually normalized

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Scheduled job Discovery Model Normalization (sysauto_script) runs daily.

While A seems correct, I think E is the most correct. "A scheduled job for the normalization process runs daily. Whenever a new discovery model is created, the normalization process is run and the status is indicated."

comments.content: Hmmmmmm, actually it's still [A] because what is happening "...whenever a new discovery model is created" is not a scheduled job but a business rule.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
- Scheduled job ‘Discovery Model Normalization (sysauto_script) runs daily.

Selected Answer: A
It's answer A -

Selected Answer: A
Runs daily
I agree it's A

questions.question_text: How often is the scheduled job for the normalization process run?

choices.C: Query the scheduled job reports to determine if the “Software Content Library Download” (samp_cds_download) job has completed yet.
choices.B: Determine if the business rule “Create a Software Normalization Download” has been triggered yet or not.
choices.D: Review the number of records in the samp_product_map table. If there are ~7,700 records in the table, the download has completed at least once.
choices.A: Review the Last updated date of the Central Data Service Download Status jobs on the Normalization and Content Service dashboard.

questions.question_text: Discovery models may not be fully normalized until updated content is downloaded from the ServiceNow Software Content Library. How do you determine if the content has been downloaded?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct answer is A according to the documentation

The Central Data Service Download Status related list is updated daily when the SAM — Central Data Service Download Status job is run.

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/sam-normalization-dash.html

Selected Answer: A
A seems the most logical one

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/sam-normalization-dash.html
I agree, the Answer should be A - it is also on page 132 of the SN SamPro text that came with the course.

Selected Answer: B
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/downgrade-rights.html

If there is no software model corresponding to a discovery map, when populating the Downgrade Rights [samp_sw_downgrade_model] table, a new software model is automatically created.

questions.question_text: When populating the Downgrade Rights table, if there is no software model corresponding to a discovery map, which of the following is automatically created?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
From the course:
If a matching record is found in the Software Discovery Model table [cmdb_sam_sw_install], then the Software Installation table updates the software discovery model record. If a record is not found, a new record is created. Data is then passed to the Software [cmdb_ci_spkg] table to preserve backward compatibility.

Selected Answer: E
cmbd_sam_sw_install should be cmdb_sam_sw_install

comments.content: Agreed! I noticed that each answer has "CMBD" as the prefix...could throw people off because "D." is the only correct Prefix, but that table does not exist.

questions.question_text: For software asset management, when software is discovered, the records from the discovered pattern are copied into which table?
